snippet: Students at Princeton had their brain activity monitored, and learned to recognize that their attention was lagging.
abstract: Dr Nicholas B Turke-Browne study in journal Nature Neuroscience concludes that real-time brain monitoring can be used to remind people when their attention wanders from repetitive task and to help them maintain their focus.
lead_paragraph: Students at Princeton had their brain activity monitored, and learned to recognize that their attention was lagging.

headline.print_headline: Neuroscience: Training the Mind Not to Wander
